shortDescription.en-GB: a little wet in the air
shortDescription.en-US: a little wet in the air

definitions.definition: A little wet in the air or on the walls in houses.

en-GB.text: The basement feels damp and cold after the long rainy winter months.

en-US.text: The basement feels damp and cold after the long rainy winter months.

en-GB.text: Use damp as an adjective to describe a room that is a little wet.

en-US.text: Use damp as an adjective to describe a room that is a little wet.

en-GB.text: The damp wall needed new paint and a repair to stop the moisture.

en-US.text: The damp wall needed new paint and a repair to stop the moisture.

shortDescription.en-GB: an empty job or room
shortDescription.en-US: an empty job or room

definitions.definition: An empty job or room that someone can use or fill now.

en-GB.text: The hotel had one vacancy for the weekend during the busy season.

en-US.text: The hotel had one vacancy for the weekend during the busy season.

en-GB.text: The company posted a vacancy for a teacher in the local school today.

en-US.text: The company posted a vacancy for a teacher in the local school today.

en-GB.text: There was a vacancy in the flat and we could move in next month.

en-US.text: There was a vacancy in the flat and we could move in next month.

shortDescription.en-GB: a small simple house
shortDescription.en-US: a small simple house

definitions.definition: A small simple house made of wood or other plain materials outside.

en-GB.text: We stayed in a small hut by the lake during our village visit.

en-US.text: We stayed in a small hut by the lake during our village visit.

en-GB.text: The farmer kept a wood hut near the field for tools and rest stops.

en-US.text: The farmer kept a wood hut near the field for tools and rest stops.

en-GB.text: The small hut had a bed and a small stove for cooking and warmth.

en-US.text: The small hut had a bed and a small stove for cooking and warmth.

shortDescription.en-GB: on or to a higher floor
shortDescription.en-US: on or to a higher floor

definitions.definition: On or to a higher floor in a building, above the ground floor.

en-GB.text: Please go upstairs and take the blue book from the top shelf now.

en-US.text: Please go upstairs and take the blue book from the top shelf now.

en-GB.text: We use upstairs as an adverb to say where someone must go in a house.

en-US.text: We use upstairs as an adverb to say where someone must go in a house.

en-GB.text: The children were playing upstairs near the window while I made dinner downstairs.

en-US.text: The children were playing upstairs near the window while I made dinner downstairs.

shortDescription.en-GB: to make something like new
shortDescription.en-US: to make something like new

definitions.definition: To repair or return something so it looks and works like new again.

en-GB.text: They will restore the old house to the original style next summer.

en-US.text: They will restore the old house to the original style next summer.

en-GB.text: You need good tools to restore wooden furniture that is old and broken.

en-US.text: You need good tools to restore wooden furniture that is old and broken.

en-GB.text: The town will restore the old castle to save the history for visitors.

en-US.text: The town will restore the old castle to save the history for visitors.

en-GB.text: They plan to restore the roof and windows before winter comes this year.

en-US.text: They plan to restore the roof and windows before winter comes this year.

shortDescription.en-GB: level or even; also an apartment
shortDescription.en-US: level or even; also an apartment

definitions.definition: Level and even, with no high or low parts on a surface or road.

en-GB.text: The table is flat so the glass did not fall or move at all.

en-US.text: The table is flat so the glass did not fall or move at all.

en-GB.text: Flat is an adjective that describes a surface which is smooth and even.

en-US.text: Flat is an adjective that describes a surface which is smooth and even.

en-GB.text: They rent a flat near the school to be close to their work each day.

en-US.text: They rent a flat near the school to be close to their work each day.

shortDescription.en-GB: a short sleep during the day
shortDescription.en-US: a short sleep during the day

definitions.definition: A short sleep during the day to rest and feel more ready to work.

en-GB.text: After lunch she had a short nap on the sofa to feel better later.

en-US.text: After lunch she had a short nap on the sofa to feel better later.

en-GB.text: He took a quick nap on the couch before starting his evening chores.

en-US.text: He took a quick nap on the couch before starting his evening chores.

en-GB.text: Doctors often say a short nap can help a tired person feel more alert.

en-US.text: Doctors often say a short nap can help a tired person feel more alert.

shortDescription.en-GB: to bend or make something smaller
shortDescription.en-US: to bend or make something smaller

definitions.definition: To bend something so one part lies on another part to make it smaller.

en-GB.text: Please fold the shirt carefully and put it into the clean drawer now.

en-US.text: Please fold the shirt carefully and put it into the clean drawer now.

en-GB.text: I fold my clothes after washing and place them on the shelf in order.

en-US.text: I fold my clothes after washing and place them on the shelf in order.

en-GB.text: Fold is a common verb that students learn to use with many objects.

en-US.text: Fold is a common verb that students learn to use with many objects.

en-GB.text: After dinner we fold the paper napkins and place them on the table.

en-US.text: After dinner we fold the paper napkins and place them on the table.

shortDescription.en-GB: to remove a cover or find out something
shortDescription.en-US: to remove a cover or find out something

definitions.definition: To remove a cover or hiding and see what is under it or what happened.

en-GB.text: The police will uncover the facts about the missing bag this week.

en-US.text: The police will uncover the facts about the missing bag this week.

en-GB.text: Uncover is a common verb used when you remove a lid or reveal something hidden.

en-US.text: Uncover is a common verb used when you remove a lid or reveal something hidden.

en-GB.text: Please uncover the pot so the soup can cool before you serve it to guests.

en-US.text: Please uncover the pot so the soup can cool before you serve it to guests.

shortDescription.en-GB: on the floor above the ground floor
shortDescription.en-US: on the floor above the ground floor

definitions.definition: On or of the floor above the ground floor in a building or house.

en-GB.text: Their first-floor flat has two bedrooms and a small balcony with a view.

en-US.text: Their first-floor flat has two bedrooms and a small balcony with a view.

en-GB.text: First-floor is an adjective that tells you which floor a room is on.

en-US.text: First-floor is an adjective that tells you which floor a room is on.

en-GB.text: The first-floor bedroom gets more light and a better view than the basement room.

en-US.text: The first-floor bedroom gets more light and a better view than the basement room.

shortDescription.en-GB: working the whole normal week
shortDescription.en-US: working the whole normal week

definitions.definition: Working the usual number of hours for a job during the week or week days.

en-GB.text: She has a full-time job and she works five days every week in town.

en-US.text: She has a full-time job and she works five days every week in town.

en-GB.text: Full-time is an adjective used to describe work with regular full working hours.

en-US.text: Full-time is an adjective used to describe work with regular full working hours.

en-GB.text: He studies full-time at the college and he attends lessons every weekday morning.

en-US.text: He studies full-time at the college and he attends lessons every weekday morning.

en-GB.text: The company offers both part-time and full-time positions to new applicants this month.

en-US.text: The company offers both part-time and full-time positions to new applicants this month.

shortDescription.en-GB: the social or official position
shortDescription.en-US: the social or official position

definitions.definition: The social or official position of a person or thing in a group or system.

en-GB.text: Her new job changed her status at work and people treated her differently.

en-US.text: Her new job changed her status at work and people treated her differently.

en-GB.text: People speak about status when they describe a person place or social position.

en-US.text: People speak about status when they describe a person place or social position.

en-GB.text: His job title changed so his status in the company became higher than before.

en-US.text: His job title changed so his status in the company became higher than before.

shortDescription.en-GB: to make something longer or larger
shortDescription.en-US: to make something longer or larger

definitions.definition: To make something longer in time or larger in size or area than before.

en-GB.text: They will extend the road to reach the new houses by next year.

en-US.text: They will extend the road to reach the new houses by next year.

en-GB.text: Extend is a common verb used when you make time space or size larger.

en-US.text: Extend is a common verb used when you make time space or size larger.

en-GB.text: The company will extend the contract for another year because the work continues.

en-US.text: The company will extend the contract for another year because the work continues.

en-GB.text: They plan to extend the kitchen by adding a new room to the back.

en-US.text: They plan to extend the kitchen by adding a new room to the back.

shortDescription.en-GB: the business of visitors and travel
shortDescription.en-US: the business of visitors and travel

definitions.definition: The business and activity of people visiting places for pleasure and travel.

en-GB.text: Tourism brings many visitors to the coast every summer for sun and food.

en-US.text: Tourism brings many visitors to the coast every summer for sun and food.

en-GB.text: Many people work in tourism in this town during the busy summer months each year.

en-US.text: Many people work in tourism in this town during the busy summer months each year.

en-GB.text: We learned about tourism and planned a short holiday to the nearby islands.

en-US.text: We learned about tourism and planned a short holiday to the nearby islands.

shortDescription.en-GB: a part of an organisation or shop
shortDescription.en-US: a part of an organization or shop

definitions.definition: A part of a company shop or school that has a particular job or service.

en-GB.text: She works in the sales department and helps customers choose the right items.

en-US.text: She works in the sales department and helps customers choose the right items.

en-GB.text: The HR department will answer your question about work hours and pay today.

en-US.text: The HR department will answer your question about work hours and pay today.

en-GB.text: This department handles official forms and documents for people in the city.

en-US.text: This department handles official forms and documents for people in the city.

en-GB.text: The toy department is near the entrance and has many colourful items for children.

en-US.text: The toy department is near the entrance and has many colorful items for children.

shortDescription.en-GB: to go away from a place
shortDescription.en-US: to go away from a place

definitions.definition: To go away from a place or person, or to allow someone to go.

en-GB.text: We will leave the house at seven to catch the early morning bus today.

en-US.text: We will leave the house at seven to catch the early morning bus today.

en-GB.text: Leave is a common verb students use when they talk about going away from home.

en-US.text: Leave is a common verb students use when they talk about going away from home.

en-GB.text: She asked for leave from work to care for a sick family member this week.

en-US.text: She asked for leave from work to care for a sick family member this week.

shortDescription.en-GB: an idea offered for agreement
shortDescription.en-US: an idea offered for agreement

definitions.definition: An idea or plan that someone offers for others to accept or refuse.

en-GB.text: He gave a clear proposal for the new project at the meeting yesterday morning.

en-US.text: He gave a clear proposal for the new project at the meeting yesterday morning.

en-GB.text: The manager read the proposal and will decide on the new hires next week.

en-US.text: The manager read the proposal and will decide on the new hires next week.

en-GB.text: The council discussed the proposal to build a small park near the school today.

en-US.text: The council discussed the proposal to build a small park near the school today.

en-GB.text: She wrote a proposal to ask for help from a friend for the event idea.

en-US.text: She wrote a proposal to ask for help from a friend for the event idea.

shortDescription.en-GB: to go round and watch an area
shortDescription.en-US: to go round and watch an area

definitions.definition: To walk, drive or go around an area to check safety or look for problems.

en-GB.text: The guard will patrol the park every night to keep people and property safe.

en-US.text: The guard will patrol the park every night to keep people and property safe.

en-GB.text: He works as a security officer and must patrol the building for six hours each shift.

en-US.text: He works as a security officer and must patrol the building for six hours each shift.

en-GB.text: Police patrol the streets at night to help keep the area safe for everyone.

en-US.text: Police patrol the streets at night to help keep the area safe for everyone.

en-GB.text: Airport security officers patrol the terminal to watch for any safety concerns all day.

en-US.text: Airport security officers patrol the terminal to watch for any safety concerns all day.

shortDescription.en-GB: to make a careful guess about size
shortDescription.en-US: to make a careful guess about size

definitions.definition: To make a careful guess about the number, cost, size, or time of something.

en-GB.text: They estimate the cost of the repair will be high but they will check soon.

en-US.text: They estimate the cost of the repair will be high but they will check soon.

en-GB.text: Estimate is a common verb used when you give a number that may not be exact.

en-US.text: Estimate is a common verb used when you give a number that may not be exact.

en-GB.text: The manager asked the team to estimate the time needed to finish the task.

en-US.text: The manager asked the team to estimate the time needed to finish the task.

en-GB.text: We estimate our monthly bills to plan the family budget for the next year.

en-US.text: We estimate our monthly bills to plan the family budget for the next year.

shortDescription.en-GB: on the other side or very different
shortDescription.en-US: on the other side or very different

definitions.definition: Very different from something else or at the other side of a place.

en-GB.text: Her idea was the opposite of mine and we had to discuss it slowly together.

en-US.text: Her idea was the opposite of mine and we had to discuss it slowly together.

definitions.definition: At the other side of something, facing it with only a short space between.

en-GB.text: The bank is opposite the station, so you will see it across the road easily.

en-US.text: The bank is opposite the station, so you will see it across the road easily.

en-GB.text: Opposite is an adjective you can use to show two ideas are very different from each other.

en-US.text: Opposite is an adjective you can use to show two ideas are very different from each other.

en-GB.text: Use opposite as a preposition to say one thing is on the other side of another thing.

en-US.text: Use opposite as a preposition to say one thing is on the other side of another thing.

shortDescription.en-GB: not able to help or work
shortDescription.en-US: not able to help or work

definitions.definition: Not able to do the job or not helpful, so it is without real use.

en-GB.text: The broken phone was useless so she bought a new one the same week quickly.

en-US.text: The broken phone was useless so she bought a new one the same week quickly.

en-GB.text: Useless is an adjective people use when something cannot do its job at all.

en-US.text: Useless is an adjective people use when something cannot do its job at all.

en-GB.text: He felt useless after losing his job, but friends helped him find a new role.

en-US.text: He felt useless after losing his job, but friends helped him find a new role.

shortDescription.en-GB: wanting to do or have something
shortDescription.en-US: wanting to do or have something

definitions.definition: Wanting very much to do or have something, and ready to start or try now.

en-GB.text: The children were eager to see the new film and they waited at the cinema early.

en-US.text: The children were eager to see the new film and they waited at the cinema early.

en-GB.text: Eager is an adjective used when someone shows strong wish or excitement to do something.

en-US.text: Eager is an adjective used when someone shows strong wish or excitement to do something.

en-GB.text: He was eager to meet his friends after the long trip far from the city.

en-US.text: He was eager to meet his friends after the long trip far from the city.

shortDescription.en-GB: the direction between south and east
shortDescription.en-US: the direction between south and east

definitions.definition: In or from the part of an area or country that is between south and east.

en-GB.text: The village is in the southeast part of the island near the small harbour town.

en-US.text: The village is in the southeast part of the island near the small harbor town.

en-GB.text: Southeast is an adjective used when you describe the location of a place on a map.

en-US.text: Southeast is an adjective used when you describe the location of a place on a map.

en-GB.text: The weather in the southeast region is often warm and sunny in the summer months.

en-US.text: The weather in the southeast region is often warm and sunny in the summer months.

shortDescription.en-GB: in or from the south part
shortDescription.en-US: in or from the south part

definitions.definition: In or from the southern part of a country or area, near the south side.

en-GB.text: The southern coast has many small towns and it is warm in the summer months.

en-US.text: The southern coast has many small towns and it is warm in the summer months.

en-GB.text: Southern is an adjective used to describe the part of a country that is to the south.

en-US.text: Southern is an adjective used to describe the part of a country that is to the south.

en-GB.text: The southern area of the island has hills and many small beaches for visitors to enjoy.

en-US.text: The southern area of the island has hills and many small beaches for visitors to enjoy.

shortDescription.en-GB: hot and wet weather area
shortDescription.en-US: hot and wet weather area

definitions.definition: Related to regions that are hot all year and often have a lot of rain.

en-GB.text: The tropical island has green plants and warm weather most months of the year.

en-US.text: The tropical island has green plants and warm weather most months of the year.

en-GB.text: Tropical is an adjective used to describe hot wet places near the equator on maps.

en-US.text: Tropical is an adjective used to describe hot wet places near the equator on maps.

en-GB.text: Many tropical forests have wide trees and many animals that live near water areas.

en-US.text: Many tropical forests have wide trees and many animals that live near water areas.

en-GB.text: The weather in tropical regions is often warm with heavy rain in the wet season.

en-US.text: The weather in tropical regions is often warm with heavy rain in the wet season.
